concepts.concept_name: Cell as the basic unit of life

in_scope: Cell as the structural and functional unit of life
Discovery of cell by Robert Hooke
Cell theory: all living organisms are made of cells
Plasma membrane: selectively permeable, osmosis, diffusion
Cell wall in plant cells: rigidity and protection
Nucleus: nuclear membrane, chromosomes, DNA, chromatin
Cytoplasm and its role
Endoplasmic reticulum: smooth and rough ER
Golgi apparatus: packaging and secretion
Lysosomes: digestive enzymes, suicide bags
Mitochondria: powerhouse of the cell, ATP production
Plastids: chloroplasts, chromoplasts, leucoplasts
Vacuoles: storage, turgor pressure in plant cells
Prokaryotic cells: no membrane-bound nucleus (bacteria)
Eukaryotic cells: membrane-bound nucleus (plants, animals)
Differences between plant and animal cells
Cell division: mitosis and meiosis (introduction)
out_of_scope: Detailed molecular biology of cell membrane — Class 11
Stages of mitosis and meiosis in detail — Class 10-11

concepts.concept_name: Simple permanent tissues: parenchyma, collenchyma, sclerenchyma
Complex permanent tissues: xylem and phloem
Animal tissues: epithelial, connective, muscular, nervous

in_scope: Tissue: group of cells with similar structure and function
Need for tissues in multicellular organisms
Meristematic tissue: apical, lateral, intercalary
Characteristics: actively dividing, thin-walled, dense cytoplasm
Parenchyma: thin-walled, living, stores food, photosynthesis
Collenchyma: thickened corners, flexibility
Sclerenchyma: thick lignified walls, dead, mechanical support
Xylem: vessels, tracheids, xylem fibres, xylem parenchyma — water transport
Phloem: sieve tubes, companion cells, phloem fibres, phloem parenchyma — food transport
Epithelial tissue: squamous, cuboidal, columnar, glandular
Connective tissue: blood, bone, cartilage, ligament, tendon, areolar, adipose
Muscular tissue: striated (skeletal), smooth (unstriated), cardiac
Nervous tissue: neurons, dendrites, axon, nerve impulse
out_of_scope: Detailed histology and staining techniques — Class 11
Secondary growth and cambium details — Class 11

in_scope: Need for classification of living organisms
Hierarchy: Kingdom, Phylum/Division, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species
Whittaker's five kingdom classification
Kingdom Monera: bacteria, cyanobacteria, prokaryotic
Kingdom Protista: unicellular eukaryotes, Amoeba, Paramecium
Kingdom Fungi: saprophytic, cell wall of chitin, mushroom, yeast
Kingdom Plantae: autotrophic, cell wall of cellulose
Kingdom Animalia: heterotrophic, multicellular eukaryotes
Plant divisions: Thallophyta, Bryophyta, Pteridophyta, Gymnosperms, Angiosperms
Angiosperms: monocots and dicots
Animal phyla: Porifera, Coelenterata, Platyhelminthes, Nematoda, Annelida, Arthropoda, Mollusca, Echinodermata, Protochordata, Vertebrata
Vertebrata: Pisces, Amphibia, Reptilia, Aves, Mammalia
Binomial nomenclature by Carolus Linnaeus
Biodiversity and its importance
out_of_scope: Detailed morphology and anatomy of organisms — Class 11

in_scope: Health: state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being
Disease: any condition that impairs normal functioning
Acute diseases: short duration (cold, flu)
Chronic diseases: long duration (diabetes, tuberculosis)
Infectious (communicable) diseases: caused by microorganisms
Non-infectious (non-communicable) diseases: not caused by microorganisms
Pathogens: bacteria, virus, fungi, protozoa, worms
Bacterial diseases: tuberculosis, cholera, typhoid
Viral diseases: common cold, influenza, AIDS, dengue
Fungal diseases: skin infections, ringworm
Protozoan diseases: malaria, kala-azar
Means of spread: air, water, contact, vectors
Organ-specific and tissue-specific manifestations
Immune system: first line and second line of defence
Vaccination and immunization
Principles of treatment: kill pathogen vs reduce symptoms
Antibiotics and their use
Prevention: personal hygiene, clean water, vaccination, vector control
out_of_scope: Detailed immunology and antibody structure — Class 11-12

in_scope: Biosphere: life-supporting zone of Earth
Atmosphere: troposphere, stratosphere and their roles
Water cycle: evaporation, condensation, precipitation
Nitrogen cycle: nitrogen fixation, nitrification, denitrification
Carbon cycle: photosynthesis, respiration, combustion, decomposition
Oxygen cycle: photosynthesis and respiration balance
Air pollution: causes, effects, and control measures
Greenhouse effect and global warming
Water pollution: causes, effects, and control measures
Soil formation: weathering (physical, chemical, biological)
Soil erosion and methods of prevention
Ozone layer: formation and importance
Ozone depletion: CFCs and their effect
Conservation of natural resources

concepts.concept_name: Animal husbandry: cattle and poultry farming

in_scope: Food sources: plants and animals
Kharif and rabi crops with examples
Crop variety improvement: hybridisation, GMOs
Desired agronomic characteristics: higher yield, disease resistance
Crop production management: nutrient management, irrigation, cropping patterns
Manures: compost, vermicompost, green manure
Fertilizers: nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium based
Difference between manure and fertilizer
Irrigation methods: wells, canals, river lift systems, tanks
Cropping patterns: mixed cropping, intercropping, crop rotation
Crop protection: weeds, insect pests, diseases
Storage of grains: factors causing losses, preventive measures
Cattle farming: milch and draught animals, breeds
Poultry farming: broilers and layers, management
Fish production: marine and inland fisheries, aquaculture
Bee keeping (apiculture): Apis species, honey, beeswax
out_of_scope: Detailed genetics of crop improvement — Class 12
Economic aspects and agricultural policy — beyond syllabus
